page.title: 16HADLEIGH BYPASS
page.content: When the Bypass was finished the grass verges had to be sown with a special grass and wild flower seed mixture. This was done because the people of Hadleigh had been worried about the loss of wild plants when the road was built.Now the grass and plants have grown the area looks much better. Beside the Bypass, on what used to be Aldham Common, is a memorial to Dr.Rowland Taylor.Dr.Rowland Taylor was a Rector of Hadleigh and was burnt at the stake here in 1555. During the time of 15 minutes at 1.30p.m. on a June day we recorded the flow of traffic: Lorries: 10 Cars: 56 Vans: 12 Other: 2 The bypass was quite busy and the traffic was travelling at fairly high speeds.
